page.title: 02Farming around Penkridge
page.content: Crops grown in 1985 in the Penkridge area depend a great deal on the size of the farm. The smaller holdings (up to 50 acres) are usually dairy farms and they therefore grow grass for silage for winter feed, hay and provide summer grazing for cattle. The larger units have a 4 year rotation of crops, this helps to prevent a build up of disease in the soil. The local crops are Oilseed Rape, Winter wheat (grown either for milling or next years seed), Barley (for cattle feed or malting) and Potatoes (usually second earlies). A few specialist crops are also grown such as sugarbeet for seed (although Penkridge is a long way from the factories), daffodils for the bulbs, strawberries for self- picking and sometimes Peas which are dried for human consumption or put into cattle feed.
